summary: Chapter 1 - Airport Coffee
title: Chapter 1 - Airport Coffee
body:
The rewrite is here!! Welcome to the story of Harry and Poppy from the very beginning.  A big thanks to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight  for everything she does and to @harrysofluffy for listening to me talk about this that and everything.  Let me know what you think!! 

Master Post 


March 2nd 2013, Sydney, Australia

Airports were not Poppy’s favourite place in the world. She hated crowds, she hated flying and she hated goodbyes.  But here she was, in the middle of Sydney Airport, saying goodbye to her family about to board the plane that was going to take her to her new life in London. Nervous was an understatement, not only was she about to be sitting in a giant metal box that could fall out of the sky at any given moment for the next 28 hours, but when she landed she would be starting her whole life fresh and that was equally as terrifying.

Her Mother’s warm arms wrapped and her and tears formed in Poppy’s eyes and as hard as she tried to choke them back, she knew they were going to fall.

“Call me when you land, won’t you Pop?” her Mum said, tears filling her eyes too.

“Of course Mum” Poppy smiled, “You know I will”

They both let go of the hug they were so tightly embraced in and Poppy moved on to say goodbye to her little sister, Addison

“Don’t forget about me while you’re over there” Addie said, trying to play it off as a joke

“I could never” Poppy replied mimicking her tone. “Tell Kai and Susie I said goodbye too, yeah?”

“Yeah” Addie nodded. Kai was Poppy’s older brother and Susie was his wife, they lived together in Melbourne and said their proper goodbyes to Poppy the last time she’d been down to visit them. She knew she wouldn’t miss them that much compared to the rest of her family that she was used to seeing everyday, but part of her heart would still ache for them time to time, and it felt wrong saying goodbye to everyone else without mentioning them.  

Poppy’s dad wasn’t the best at goodbyes either, and by the time Poppy got round to him he was already a mess.

“Just don’t do anything stupid while you’re over there Pop, I won’t be just around the corner to come and rescue you” he said

“When have you ever had to do that here Dad?” she giggled

“There’s a first for everything”

Poppy rolled her eyes and hugged her dad one last time “I’ll see you at christmas Dad, Love you”

“I love you too Pop.” And with that Poppy turned and walked through the departures gate. She was in a daze as she passed through security because she couldn’t quite believe that this was really happening. A dream she’d had since she was 15 was unfolding right in front of her eyes but there was a bittersweetness to it. Everything she’d ever dreamed of was at the other end of this plane journey, but she’d just said goodbye to everything she’d ever known and she knew she’d miss home.

There was still an hour left before Poppy’s plane was set to leave the runway so once she’d found her gate and knew where she had to go, Poppy found the nearest coffee shop and ordered herself a peppermint tea to try and calm her nerves. She wanted a coffee, but after living off it for weeks during her final high school exams she made a rule for herself that she was only allowed one cup a week, and she figured that it was best reserved for after she lands. The hot tea washed over her tongue and she felt more relaxed almost instantly. She watched as the world went by for the next hour, watching as people went off on their holidays or left for their work trips, Poppy liked to give each person a story. The girl with the red suitcase was going to New York, to start a job as a journalist at some big magazine, Cosmo maybe. The man in the suit was flying to Hong Kong for business but he would also get to his family while he’s there. The group of girls squealing next to her were off on their Gap Year Trip to europe, they might even be on the same flight as her, although she hoped that they would be sitting far away from her. The family in the corner of the cafe were off on a quick trip to Bali because flights were cheap and they needed to get away from humdrum of city life.

Poppy’s thoughts were interrupted by a voice over the intercom calling for her to board her flight. So she picked up her duffle bag and her boarding pass and made her way to her gate. Tears filled her eyes as she walked and it took everything in her not to turn around and walk right back into her comfort zone, but she breathed deeply and handed her pass to the light attendant at who stood next to the tunnel that lead to the plane.

“Have a nice flight” she said kindly and Poppy smiled at her.

***

March 3rd, 7am London, UK.

Poppy never realised just how far away from the rest of the world she had been until she landed at Heathrow Airport and everything crumbled in front of her as she read the email that came through when she connected to the Starbucks Wifi as she waited for her much needed coffee.

“Dear Miss Thomas

Unfortunately, the apartment that you have secured for rent will now be unavailable until 31/3/13 as it is currently unfit to live in. The apartment will be fumigated and we will keep you updated on when it is safe for you to move in.  We apologise for any inconvenience that this will cause and wish you well with your travels. Don’t hesitate to contact us with any enquiries you may have.

Iris Goodall, Relocations Manager.”

Home was half a world away, and Poppy was out of her depths. She was 19, in a foreign country with no place to go and all she wanted right now was a hug from her mum. In her haze of stress, she didn’t notice what had been going on around her or that her name had been called several times signalling that her coffee was ready.

“Are you Poopy” a tall brunette boy with a husky British accent asked, tearing her away from her web search of cheap hotels in London

“No” she said quietly “but I am Poppy”

“One letter off, that’s not bad for a Starbucks this busy”he handed her the drink and smiled a lazy half smile that made her blush “speaking of busy, you mind if I sit here?”

“Go for it” Poppy said, returning to her search. The boy didn’t say much else for a while but Poppy couldn’t help but recognise his face. She didn’t know where from, but his wild curls and green eyes looked familiar, but how could they be? He was clearly British and if she’d met him before she would have remembered. It wasn’t until she read the name on his cup that it all clicked

“You’re that kid from that band!” She exclaimed louder than she intended causing a few people around them to turn and stare. The boy waved them off nervously, thankful that they were mostly middle aged men who wouldn’t give two cents about the band he was in.

“I am” he said much quieter “but I prefer to go by Harry”

“Or Hairy” Poppy said pointing to his drink

“Hairy and Poopy, I like it” Harry smiled. “So what brings you to London?”

“I’m moving here for university, I got a scholarship to come here all expenses paid but I’ve got an email to say that I’ve got nowhere to live for three weeks”

Harry crumpled his eyebrows “Shouldn’t they arrange something for you if things fell through?”

“I don’t know,” Poppy sighed “maybe”

“Can I see the email?” He asked, looking towards her phone. She nodded and unlocked it and handed it to him with the email already open. His brows crumpled again as he read it.

“They can’t just let you be homeless for three weeks,they should get you a hotel,I’ll call them for you if you like, get it all sorted?”

Poppy was taken aback by his kindness, it wasn’t something she expected from a random stranger let alone a stranger as famous as him.

“No no that’s fine” she said “I’ll figure something out”

“Poopy, I don’t know how much you know about London in March, but the weather can be somewhat sporadic, you can’t sleep on the streets”

“I’m not going to sleep on the streets Hairy, I’ll get a hotel”

He drew his lips into a tight line and ran his fingers through his hair.

“Come and stay with me” he said almost out of nowhere

“I just met you”

“And? I’m barely home the next few weeks anyway, you’ll have the place to yourself for most of the time”

“You could be a murderer” She said harshly

“That would be bad for publicity” he giggled “Harry Styles lets homeless exchange student into his home, is a much better headline”

Poppy thought about for a second, “I can’t just come and live with you Harry”

“It’s only three weeks” he sighed “You’ll have your own bedroom, bathroom, living room, the only time you’ll have to see me is when you’re hungry”

“I get hungry a lot” Poppy said

“Me too”

“We can eat together then. Plus the way my schedule looks right now, I’ll hardly be around”

“I still don’t know”

“I promise everything will be ok, but if don’t want to stay with me at least let me find you a hotel to stay in”

“Fine” Poppy agreed “I’ll stay, but only for a few days while I sort this whole thing out”

“Great!!” Harry exclaimed “Let’s head off then, if we go now we’ll hit traffic, but we should avoid paparazzi looking for a scoop” he said standing up and throwing his backpack over his shoulder before picking up Poppy’s suitcase

“Ahh” she nodded “that’s why you’re here so early”

Harry nodded “that and my flight got in early so I didn’t have much choice in the matter”

It took Poppy more than a few days to sort everything out. Three weeks turned into four and before she knew it she’d been living with Harry for two months. Like he said, he wasn’t home much, but she got the feeling that when he was, he enjoyed having her around. It didn’t take long for the strangers in an airport coffee shop to become friends and it was a friendship that would last a lifetime.

“I just met you”

“And? I’m barely home the next few weeks anyway, you’ll have the place to yourself for most of the time”

“You could be a murderer” She said harshly

“That would be bad for publicity” he giggled “Harry Styles lets homeless exchange student into his home, is a much better headline”

Poppy thought about for a second, “I can’t just come and live with you Harry”

“It’s only three weeks” he sighed “You’ll have your own bedroom, bathroom, living room, the only time you’ll have to see me is when you’re hungry”

“I get hungry a lot” Poppy said

“Me too”

“We can eat together then. Plus the way my schedule looks right now, I’ll hardly be around”

“I still don’t know”

“I promise everything will be ok, but if don’t want to stay with me at least let me find you a hotel to stay in”

“Fine” Poppy agreed “I’ll stay, but only for a few days while I sort this whole thing out”

“Great!!” Harry exclaimed “Let’s head off then, if we go now we’ll hit traffic, but we should avoid paparazzi looking for a scoop” he said standing up and throwing his backpack over his shoulder before picking up Poppy’s suitcase

“Ahh” she nodded “that’s why you’re here so early”

Harry nodded “that and my flight got in early so I didn’t have much choice in the matter”

It took Poppy more than a few days to sort everything out. Three weeks turned into four and before she knew it she’d been living with Harry for two months. Like he said, he wasn’t home much, but she got the feeling that when he was, he enjoyed having her around. It didn’t take long for the strangers in an airport coffee shop to become friends and it was a friendship that would last a lifetime.
trail.content:
The rewrite is here!! Welcome to the story of Harry and Poppy from the very beginning.  A big thanks to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight  for everything she does and to @harrysofluffy for listening to me talk about this that and everything.  Let me know what you think!! 

Master Post 


March 2nd 2013, Sydney, Australia

Airports were not Poppy’s favourite place in the world. She hated crowds, she hated flying and she hated goodbyes.  But here she was, in the middle of Sydney Airport, saying goodbye to her family about to board the plane that was going to take her to her new life in London. Nervous was an understatement, not only was she about to be sitting in a giant metal box that could fall out of the sky at any given moment for the next 28 hours, but when she landed she would be starting her whole life fresh and that was equally as terrifying.

Her Mother’s warm arms wrapped and her and tears formed in Poppy’s eyes and as hard as she tried to choke them back, she knew they were going to fall.

“Call me when you land, won’t you Pop?” her Mum said, tears filling her eyes too.

“Of course Mum” Poppy smiled, “You know I will”

They both let go of the hug they were so tightly embraced in and Poppy moved on to say goodbye to her little sister, Addison

“Don’t forget about me while you’re over there” Addie said, trying to play it off as a joke

“I could never” Poppy replied mimicking her tone. “Tell Kai and Susie I said goodbye too, yeah?”

“Yeah” Addie nodded. Kai was Poppy’s older brother and Susie was his wife, they lived together in Melbourne and said their proper goodbyes to Poppy the last time she’d been down to visit them. She knew she wouldn’t miss them that much compared to the rest of her family that she was used to seeing everyday, but part of her heart would still ache for them time to time, and it felt wrong saying goodbye to everyone else without mentioning them.  

Poppy’s dad wasn’t the best at goodbyes either, and by the time Poppy got round to him he was already a mess.

“Just don’t do anything stupid while you’re over there Pop, I won’t be just around the corner to come and rescue you” he said

“When have you ever had to do that here Dad?” she giggled

“There’s a first for everything”

Poppy rolled her eyes and hugged her dad one last time “I’ll see you at christmas Dad, Love you”

“I love you too Pop.” And with that Poppy turned and walked through the departures gate. She was in a daze as she passed through security because she couldn’t quite believe that this was really happening. A dream she’d had since she was 15 was unfolding right in front of her eyes but there was a bittersweetness to it. Everything she’d ever dreamed of was at the other end of this plane journey, but she’d just said goodbye to everything she’d ever known and she knew she’d miss home.

There was still an hour left before Poppy’s plane was set to leave the runway so once she’d found her gate and knew where she had to go, Poppy found the nearest coffee shop and ordered herself a peppermint tea to try and calm her nerves. She wanted a coffee, but after living off it for weeks during her final high school exams she made a rule for herself that she was only allowed one cup a week, and she figured that it was best reserved for after she lands. The hot tea washed over her tongue and she felt more relaxed almost instantly. She watched as the world went by for the next hour, watching as people went off on their holidays or left for their work trips, Poppy liked to give each person a story. The girl with the red suitcase was going to New York, to start a job as a journalist at some big magazine, Cosmo maybe. The man in the suit was flying to Hong Kong for business but he would also get to his family while he’s there. The group of girls squealing next to her were off on their Gap Year Trip to europe, they might even be on the same flight as her, although she hoped that they would be sitting far away from her. The family in the corner of the cafe were off on a quick trip to Bali because flights were cheap and they needed to get away from humdrum of city life.

Poppy’s thoughts were interrupted by a voice over the intercom calling for her to board her flight. So she picked up her duffle bag and her boarding pass and made her way to her gate. Tears filled her eyes as she walked and it took everything in her not to turn around and walk right back into her comfort zone, but she breathed deeply and handed her pass to the light attendant at who stood next to the tunnel that lead to the plane.

“Have a nice flight” she said kindly and Poppy smiled at her.

***

March 3rd, 7am London, UK.

Poppy never realised just how far away from the rest of the world she had been until she landed at Heathrow Airport and everything crumbled in front of her as she read the email that came through when she connected to the Starbucks Wifi as she waited for her much needed coffee.

“Dear Miss Thomas

Unfortunately, the apartment that you have secured for rent will now be unavailable until 31/3/13 as it is currently unfit to live in. The apartment will be fumigated and we will keep you updated on when it is safe for you to move in.  We apologise for any inconvenience that this will cause and wish you well with your travels. Don’t hesitate to contact us with any enquiries you may have.

Iris Goodall, Relocations Manager.”

Home was half a world away, and Poppy was out of her depths. She was 19, in a foreign country with no place to go and all she wanted right now was a hug from her mum. In her haze of stress, she didn’t notice what had been going on around her or that her name had been called several times signalling that her coffee was ready.

“Are you Poopy” a tall brunette boy with a husky British accent asked, tearing her away from her web search of cheap hotels in London

“No” she said quietly “but I am Poppy”

“One letter off, that’s not bad for a Starbucks this busy”he handed her the drink and smiled a lazy half smile that made her blush “speaking of busy, you mind if I sit here?”

“Go for it” Poppy said, returning to her search. The boy didn’t say much else for a while but Poppy couldn’t help but recognise his face. She didn’t know where from, but his wild curls and green eyes looked familiar, but how could they be? He was clearly British and if she’d met him before she would have remembered. It wasn’t until she read the name on his cup that it all clicked

“You’re that kid from that band!” She exclaimed louder than she intended causing a few people around them to turn and stare. The boy waved them off nervously, thankful that they were mostly middle aged men who wouldn’t give two cents about the band he was in.

“I am” he said much quieter “but I prefer to go by Harry”

“Or Hairy” Poppy said pointing to his drink

“Hairy and Poopy, I like it” Harry smiled. “So what brings you to London?”

“I’m moving here for university, I got a scholarship to come here all expenses paid but I’ve got an email to say that I’ve got nowhere to live for three weeks”

Harry crumpled his eyebrows “Shouldn’t they arrange something for you if things fell through?”

“I don’t know,” Poppy sighed “maybe”

“Can I see the email?” He asked, looking towards her phone. She nodded and unlocked it and handed it to him with the email already open. His brows crumpled again as he read it.

“They can’t just let you be homeless for three weeks,they should get you a hotel,I’ll call them for you if you like, get it all sorted?”

Poppy was taken aback by his kindness, it wasn’t something she expected from a random stranger let alone a stranger as famous as him.

“No no that’s fine” she said “I’ll figure something out”

“Poopy, I don’t know how much you know about London in March, but the weather can be somewhat sporadic, you can’t sleep on the streets”

“I’m not going to sleep on the streets Hairy, I’ll get a hotel”

He drew his lips into a tight line and ran his fingers through his hair.

“Come and stay with me” he said almost out of nowhere

“I just met you”

“And? I’m barely home the next few weeks anyway, you’ll have the place to yourself for most of the time”

“You could be a murderer” She said harshly

“That would be bad for publicity” he giggled “Harry Styles lets homeless exchange student into his home, is a much better headline”

Poppy thought about for a second, “I can’t just come and live with you Harry”

“It’s only three weeks” he sighed “You’ll have your own bedroom, bathroom, living room, the only time you’ll have to see me is when you’re hungry”

“I get hungry a lot” Poppy said

“Me too”

“We can eat together then. Plus the way my schedule looks right now, I’ll hardly be around”

“I still don’t know”

“I promise everything will be ok, but if don’t want to stay with me at least let me find you a hotel to stay in”

“Fine” Poppy agreed “I’ll stay, but only for a few days while I sort this whole thing out”

“Great!!” Harry exclaimed “Let’s head off then, if we go now we’ll hit traffic, but we should avoid paparazzi looking for a scoop” he said standing up and throwing his backpack over his shoulder before picking up Poppy’s suitcase

“Ahh” she nodded “that’s why you’re here so early”

Harry nodded “that and my flight got in early so I didn’t have much choice in the matter”

It took Poppy more than a few days to sort everything out. Three weeks turned into four and before she knew it she’d been living with Harry for two months. Like he said, he wasn’t home much, but she got the feeling that when he was, he enjoyed having her around. It didn’t take long for the strangers in an airport coffee shop to become friends and it was a friendship that would last a lifetime.

summary: Don't say love
body:
Don't say love

Hi, This is my first FIC and idk if I like it but here it is. If you have any opinions at all about it please let me know! It is loosely based on the song “Don’t say love” by James TW.  XOXO- CC

994 words X

2 months. Harry and Y/N had been dating for 2 months. Everyone knew Harry moved fast and nobody would even give it a second glance if he was one of those celebrities that got married after 6 months of dating. Y/N, on the other hand, was quite the opposite. She wasn’t one to commit quickly. I mean it did take Harry almost 6 months to make her say yes to being exclusive with him. He can still remember every detail of the day she had finally gave in and said yes. 

“Harry? Why is it so damn dark in here?” Y/n said tossing her keys down onto the fancy side table in the entrance of his house that she told him was too expensive but he, of course, insisted it went with his aesthetic. She walked in flipping on a bunch of lights and there he was sitting on the couch in a full suit with that annoyingly beautiful dimpled grin. 100 long stem roses set out in 10 different glass vases. “Harrryyy what are you doing” she looks at him fear setting in and honestly all she wanted to do was walk out that door. But she didn’t because she locked eyes with him and she physically couldn’t move. He looked so beautiful standing there in his Gucci suit that he took from a shoot when his manager wasn’t looking even though he could’ve just asked. His hair looks like he’s ran his hands through it 100 times right before she got there because of his nerves. And of course his dimples. Those damn dimples. That’s why she stood there in shock not being able to move. Not really thinking anything until Harry decided to open his mouth. “Y/N I know you hate this stuff. And I know you’re terrified right now but I need you to listen. I’ve been chasing you for 6 months. I’ve spent every moment thinking of you. I mean you basically live here! Please please just say you’ll be my girlfriend. You basically are already everyone thinks so ya know!” She sat there thinking still not being able to speak the only thing that ran through her head was her first failed relationship and her parents’ divorces and every failed relationship that she had ever seen. He just stood there giving her time. She watched his eyes try to read hers. She was shaking with fear but the only think that came out of her mouth was “alright fine I guess I’ll be your girlfriend” Harry sighed happily and ran to hug her since she still wouldn’t move a bit. He was very thankful after like the 17th time he trapped her into saying yes. 

Today was different things had started normally. But boy did nobody expect the day to end the way it did. You see today was 8 months in Harry’s head. 2 months technically from that day Y/N was trapped into saying yes. Looking back, she doesn’t regret it at all and she was happy she took the leap but thinking long-term terrified her. A life with harry terrified her. A life without him terrified her even more. So here we are. Basically in the same place as 2 months ago but things were very different this time. Harry had finally gotten a weekend off and thought of the best idea. Y/N had just finished finals so anything right now sounded like a good idea. “You know this is the first weekend we have both had off together in a bit we should just say screw it and load up the rover and go to the beach for the weekend? He said watching her give him a tired smile and nod following him to his room which all of her stuff was basically in as well and packed for the beach. After loading up the rover and setting off to the beach it was all smiles. Harry loved nothing more than watching his girl sing along loudly to his music. She always got embarrassed when she caught him watching her because Y/N for sure thought she sounded like a 12-year-old YouTuber who would in a few years delete everything when realizing how bad they were. But Harry thought quite the opposite he always joked about you recording a song with him for his next album. By the time you got there, the sun was going to set but that didn’t bother either of them. Harry parked the Rover at the beach and walked straight down to the water hand holding Y/N’s. After finding a cozy spot Harry felt this would be the most perfect time to say it. You know. Those 3 words. He couldn’t think of a more perfect time. Relaxing on the beach at sunset. It was picture perfect. “Y/n I love” that’s all he got out before Y/n’s hand flew up to cover his mouth “don’t you dare. Don’t say it” she held her hand there and he watched the color drain from her face and her hand shakes just the same it did that day 2 months ago but this time it was different. This time he knew it wouldn’t work. “We have our whole lives to say that. We have all the time in the world to say it. I don’t want to hurt you harry. Whatever you do don’t say, Love.” He nodded slowly and she moved her hand and he kissed her softly pulling her down to the sand watching the sunset. He may not be able to say it but he definitely felt it and he knew by how scared she was she felt it too.

reblog.comment:
Don't say love

You basically are already everyone thinks so ya know!” She sat there thinking still not being able to speak the only thing that ran through her head was her first failed relationship and her parents’ divorces and every failed relationship that she had ever seen. He just stood there giving her time. She watched his eyes try to read hers. She was shaking with fear but the only think that came out of her mouth was “alright fine I guess I’ll be your girlfriend” Harry sighed happily and ran to hug her since she still wouldn’t move a bit. He was very thankful after like the 17th time he trapped her into saying yes. 

Today was different things had started normally. But boy did nobody expect the day to end the way it did. You see today was 8 months in Harry’s head. 2 months technically from that day Y/N was trapped into saying yes. Looking back, she doesn’t regret it at all and she was happy she took the leap but thinking long-term terrified her. A life with harry terrified her. A life without him terrified her even more. So here we are. Basically in the same place as 2 months ago but things were very different this time. Harry had finally gotten a weekend off and thought of the best idea. Y/N had just finished finals so anything right now sounded like a good idea. “You know this is the first weekend we have both had off together in a bit we should just say screw it and load up the rover and go to the beach for the weekend? He said watching her give him a tired smile and nod following him to his room which all of her stuff was basically in as well and packed for the beach. After loading up the rover and setting off to the beach it was all smiles. Harry loved nothing more than watching his girl sing along loudly to his music. She always got embarrassed when she caught him watching her because Y/N for sure thought she sounded like a 12-year-old YouTuber who would in a few years delete everything when realizing how bad they were. But Harry thought quite the opposite he always joked about you recording a song with him for his next album. By the time you got there, the sun was going to set but that didn’t bother either of them. Harry parked the Rover at the beach and walked straight down to the water hand holding Y/N’s. After finding a cozy spot Harry felt this would be the most perfect time to say it. You know. Those 3 words. He couldn’t think of a more perfect time. Relaxing on the beach at sunset. It was picture perfect. “Y/n I love” that’s all he got out before Y/n’s hand flew up to cover his mouth “don’t you dare. Don’t say it” she held her hand there and he watched the color drain from her face and her hand shakes just the same it did that day 2 months ago but this time it was different. This time he knew it wouldn’t work. “We have our whole lives to say that. We have all the time in the world to say it. I don’t want to hurt you harry. Whatever you do don’t say, Love.” He nodded slowly and she moved her hand and he kissed her softly pulling her down to the sand watching the sunset. He may not be able to say it but he definitely felt it and he knew by how scared she was she felt it too.

trail.content_raw:
Don't say love

Hi, This is my first FIC and idk if I like it but here it is. If you have any opinions at all about it please let me know! It is loosely based on the song “Don’t say love” by James TW.  XOXO- CC

994 words X

2 months. Harry and Y/N had been dating for 2 months. Everyone knew Harry moved fast and nobody would even give it a second glance if he was one of those celebrities that got married after 6 months of dating. Y/N, on the other hand, was quite the opposite. She wasn’t one to commit quickly. I mean it did take Harry almost 6 months to make her say yes to being exclusive with him. He can still remember every detail of the day she had finally gave in and said yes. 

“Harry? Why is it so damn dark in here?” Y/n said tossing her keys down onto the fancy side table in the entrance of his house that she told him was too expensive but he, of course, insisted it went with his aesthetic. She walked in flipping on a bunch of lights and there he was sitting on the couch in a full suit with that annoyingly beautiful dimpled grin. 100 long stem roses set out in 10 different glass vases. “Harrryyy what are you doing” she looks at him fear setting in and honestly all she wanted to do was walk out that door. But she didn’t because she locked eyes with him and she physically couldn’t move. He looked so beautiful standing there in his Gucci suit that he took from a shoot when his manager wasn’t looking even though he could’ve just asked. His hair looks like he’s ran his hands through it 100 times right before she got there because of his nerves. And of course his dimples. Those damn dimples. That’s why she stood there in shock not being able to move. Not really thinking anything until Harry decided to open his mouth. “Y/N I know you hate this stuff. And I know you’re terrified right now but I need you to listen. I’ve been chasing you for 6 months. I’ve spent every moment thinking of you. I mean you basically live here! Please please just say you’ll be my girlfriend. You basically are already everyone thinks so ya know!” She sat there thinking still not being able to speak the only thing that ran through her head was her first failed relationship and her parents’ divorces and every failed relationship that she had ever seen. He just stood there giving her time. She watched his eyes try to read hers. She was shaking with fear but the only think that came out of her mouth was “alright fine I guess I’ll be your girlfriend” Harry sighed happily and ran to hug her since she still wouldn’t move a bit. He was very thankful after like the 17th time he trapped her into saying yes. 

Today was different things had started normally. But boy did nobody expect the day to end the way it did. You see today was 8 months in Harry’s head. 2 months technically from that day Y/N was trapped into saying yes. Looking back, she doesn’t regret it at all and she was happy she took the leap but thinking long-term terrified her. A life with harry terrified her. A life without him terrified her even more. So here we are. Basically in the same place as 2 months ago but things were very different this time. Harry had finally gotten a weekend off and thought of the best idea. Y/N had just finished finals so anything right now sounded like a good idea. “You know this is the first weekend we have both had off together in a bit we should just say screw it and load up the rover and go to the beach for the weekend? He said watching her give him a tired smile and nod following him to his room which all of her stuff was basically in as well and packed for the beach. After loading up the rover and setting off to the beach it was all smiles. Harry loved nothing more than watching his girl sing along loudly to his music. She always got embarrassed when she caught him watching her because Y/N for sure thought she sounded like a 12-year-old YouTuber who would in a few years delete everything when realizing how bad they were. But Harry thought quite the opposite he always joked about you recording a song with him for his next album. By the time you got there, the sun was going to set but that didn’t bother either of them. Harry parked the Rover at the beach and walked straight down to the water hand holding Y/N’s. After finding a cozy spot Harry felt this would be the most perfect time to say it. You know. Those 3 words. He couldn’t think of a more perfect time. Relaxing on the beach at sunset. It was picture perfect. “Y/n I love” that’s all he got out before Y/n’s hand flew up to cover his mouth “don’t you dare. Don’t say it” she held her hand there and he watched the color drain from her face and her hand shakes just the same it did that day 2 months ago but this time it was different. This time he knew it wouldn’t work. “We have our whole lives to say that. We have all the time in the world to say it. I don’t want to hurt you harry. Whatever you do don’t say, Love.” He nodded slowly and she moved her hand and he kissed her softly pulling her down to the sand watching the sunset. He may not be able to say it but he definitely felt it and he knew by how scared she was she felt it too.
